TopicTitle: 32-bit Windows or 64-bit Linux for modded install?

Articles.Content:
I'm planning on starting a (very) heavily modded new game of KSP, and was wondering whether using 32-bit windows or 64-bit Linux would be more ideal (as many mods reject 64-bit windows due to bugs and other various issues).

If anyone has any more knowledge on the topic, if Linux is indeed the answer would a dual-boot or running a virtual machine (like with VMware Workstation) be better for maintaining performance? Ideally if something like workstation worked then I wouldn't have to bother with a restart every time I wanted to send poor Kerbals into the void of space.

Dual-boot, I wouldn't think performance would be good enough in a VM.

And 64bit linux is definitely the answer.
